org.jtrim2.cancel

Interface WaitableListenerRef

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ListenerRef

    public interface WaitableListenerRef
extends ListenerRef
    Defines a ListenerRef which can be used to unregister the associated listener and wait until it can be ensured that the listener is not going to be executed anymore.

    Thread safety

    The methods of this interface must be safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The unregisterAndWait method does not need to be synchronization transparent but methods inherited from ListenerRef are required to be synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    Cancellation.listenForCancellation(CancellationToken, Runnable)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void unregisterAndWait(CancellationToken cancelToken)
      Unregisters the associated listener (as the unregister method and waits until it can be ensured that the listener is not going to be notified anymore.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jtrim2.event.ListenerRef

        unregister

    • Method Detail

      • unregisterAndWait

        void unregisterAndWait(CancellationToken cancelToken)
        Unregisters the associated listener (as the unregister method and waits until it can be ensured that the listener is not going to be notified anymore. Warning: It is forbidden to call any of the close methods from within the associated listener.

        If you make a valid call to this method (valid arguments and in valid state), the listener can be considered unregistered as if unregister() has been called.

        If this method returns normally without throwing an exception, then subsequent call to this method must succeed immediately without throwing an exception (not even OperationCanceledException.

        Parameters:
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken which may signal that this method is to return immediately without waiting throwing an OperationCanceledException. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        OperationCanceledException - thrown if this method has been canceled due to being requested through the specified CancellationToken
        java.lang.NullPointerException - implementations may throw this exception if the specified CancellationToken is null
